description: Borrowed from Latin līchēn (“ringworm”), from Ancient Greek λειχήν (leikhḗn).

nouns.description: lichen (countable and uncountable, plural lichens or lichen)

entries.meaning: Any of many symbiotic organisms, being associations of algae and fungi, often found as white or yellow-to-blue–green patches on rocks, old walls, etc.
examples: The nibble marks of the stone adze were still visible, though crusted over with scale lichens in most places.

entries.meaning: (figurative) Something which gradually spreads across something else, causing damage.
